text:
hey everyone I am still in Sharjah and as you saw 
in the last episode I tasted the best date of my

life so naturally in this episode I am looking for 
more dates which actually turned out to be quite a

fascinating experience though I am here at a local 
market called souq al jubail my mission here is to

find dates because this is what I really want to 
bring back to Canada but apparently they also have

just general groceries meat fish vegetables 
so I'm super excited to go and find out what

they've got inside this souk like many things in 
this part of the world is shockingly massive and

as we walk through the grand entrance this was the 
first thing that we saw which thoroughly confused

me baskets of fish was being poured onto the floor 
while someone else is scooping fish into bins I'm

guessing it's some kind of a fish auction but 
if you know how this works please let me know

the actual fish market though was just beside 
the steam so we are now in the fish section of

the out revealed market and it is so clean I have 
never seen fish market cleaner than this place I

mean the floors pristine everything's so organized 
there's tons of fish of all sizes and it's a very

organized paying system so there's actually 
a cashier to get all your fish and then you

check out of the cache of where you can use your 
credit cards compared to a Thai market there's a

fish on the floor right now they also got shrimp 
and massive squid dried fish and sharks yeah but

the next thing we saw was my favorite part of this 
market so right behind me is the place where they

clean your fish for you so you'll buy it and for a 
small fee they will Gale and cut it to your order

that cool everyone is dressed for maximum hygiene 
and the public can watch but they're not allowed

anywhere near it they even have a ticket system so 
you know exactly when your fish is ready so now I

am in the meat section and it's mostly a lamb goat 
and deep in here but the lamb that they have here

they have the whole lamp hanging from the railing 
and my agent who's with me has actually just

bailed the smell of it is quite strong there's a 
smell of lamb and she is like I can't do it hi I'm

gonna go and wait for you outside but I really 
wanted to capture some of this footage for you

it's so cool but it's again pristine clean next 
the produce section which is entirely separate

from the fish in the meat there's a huge variety 
of produce here including the orange coconuts

from my previous episode but the highlights 
for me some of you might be about a guess

like her the most like the tiniest 
bananas I have ever seen two inches

I cannot get over he let me try the 
tiniest little banana in the world

it's good it's really soft and juicy it tastes 
like the Tyne my bananas the ones that are used

for fried bananas but but a little more tart not 
as sweet this is like my favorite banana ever make

sure you come to the sky shop he's so nice and 
amidst all these vegetables was a gorgeous honey

shop and I love honey so we just had to stop here 
okay so I she wanted us to try some white honey

from Russia from lavender which is my favorite 
sour lavender flowers there's a lot for tasting

so good I think it's whipped so it's fluffy 
really sweet really aromatic wow so this is

honey from Abu Dhabi it's very dark very 
intense it says is trumped bitter honey

which I don't know what that is but it has 
a really intense almost like dates smell

ooh tastes really caramely almost like 
caramelized palm sugar that is delicious

really it has a toasty almost like a 
toasty note what I'm about to taste is

the most expensive honey that they have 
from Yemen it's 260 durum for 125 grams

Wow oh that's so different it's very thick it's 
thicker than me even the mouthfeel is different

it's more mellow than the other one that I just 
tasted is not as toasty that is nice since I am

in the Emirates I gotta get some of that caramel 
e emirati honey and please note this beautiful

packaging a very nice touch indeed so my real 
mission here is to find dates because I'm swear

I had a taste of the dates at the mosque and 
it's the best date I've ever had in my life

so now I need to buy some and so we are in the 
date section there's endless dates like all of

this up behind me is all dates so now what do 
I do despite being completely overwhelmed by

options I managed to buy three delicious types of 
dates so curry dates which is what I had at the

mosque fat juicy medjool dates which we get in 
Canada but these are far better but these black

Aguada swirl my favorite so I have just tasted 
the ad Jiwon date so the guy at the hotel said

that we should look for at Wan dates which he 
recommends is the best kind of date and sure

enough the guy at the store has them all kept 
in the back in a special box and apparently

it's the most expensive one and it has healing 
properties I just tasted this and it's got a

chewy texture prints on the other dates that 
I've ever had has a fruitier note almost like

a raise any flavor to it lovely texture I think 
I have to get it so he let me try a fresh like

a under-ripe non dried dates from Jordan I've 
never had one before so this will be interesting

it's very sweet and really crunchy but it's 
very tannic if it coats your tongue like

if you've ever had raw green bananas that 
kind of feeling but it's incredibly sweet

mission deliciously accomplished in the 
next episode I'm heading to Dubai where

I'll have all manners of middle-eastern 
yumminess so stay tuned for that and as

always all the links you need will be in the 
description box below I'll see you next time
